PROCEDURE CODE
1210
If it orders the division, the court refers the parties to the notary-liquidator on whose person they agree or, at the reasoned request of the parties, to the two notary-liquidators whose appointment they jointly request.
If the parties fail to agree or if the court considers that the appointment of two notary-liquidators is not justified, the court shall refer the parties to another notary-liquidator appointed by the court.
If the court appoints two liquidating notaries, they shall act jointly in accordance with the provisions of this Section.
Notwithstanding articles 5 and 6, 1¡, of the law of 16th March 1803 on the organisation of the notarial profession, the two liquidating notaries act jointly in the territorial jurisdictions of each of them.
Without prejudice to the application of ¤ 4, where two liquidating notaries have been appointed, the one whose name appears first in the decision is entrusted with the custody of the minutes.
If, in the context of the partition ordered, the liquidating notary is called upon to act outside his territorial jurisdiction, he appoints a territorially competent notary for such operations.
Without prejudice to the provisions of Book One of Part Four and unless otherwise decided by the court, the parties pay the liquidating notary in equal shares.
